title: How to Turn Off the Light on an Echo Dot

steps.title: Open the Alexa app on your phone or tablet.
steps.content: Open the Alexa app on your phone or tablet. If you don't have access to the phone or tablet, you can also say "Alexa, turn on Do Not Disturb." [2] X Research source Alexa is the light-blue speech bubble with a white outline app icon that you'll find on one of your Home screens, in the app drawer, or by searching.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This is in either the upper left corner of your screen or lower right corner.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's next to a gear icon near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Device Settings.
steps.content: Tap Device Settings . You'll see this near the top of the menu.

steps.title: Tap to select your Echo Dot.
steps.content: Tap to select your Echo Dot. You'll see if your Echo Dot is considered online or offline, which may affect your DND settings. Offline devices do not have the same settings as online ones. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Do Not Disturb.
steps.content: Tap Do Not Disturb . You'll find this under the "General" heading.

steps.title: Tap the switch to turn it on next to "Do Not Disturb.
steps.content: Tap the switch to turn it on next to "Do Not Disturb. " When DND is enabled, you won't get any notifications from your Echo Dot and all the lights will be turned off. [4] X Research source If you want to set a DND schedule, tap the switch to turn it on next to "Scheduled" and select the time range you want DND to activate. To disable DND, repeat this process or say, "Alexa, turn off Do Not Disturb."

steps.title: Say to your Echo, "Alexa, what notifications do I have?
steps.content: Say to your Echo, "Alexa, what notifications do I have? " Alexa will respond with any and all notifications that could be making the light yellow and persistent. If the yellow light does not clear after you ask this, proceed to the next step. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Ask your Echo, "Alexa, what messages do I have?
steps.content: Ask your Echo, "Alexa, what messages do I have? " If you have any outstanding messages, Alexa will read them to you. If this does not clear the yellow light, proceed to the next step. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Alexa app on your phone or tablet.
steps.content: Open the Alexa app on your phone or tablet. It's the light blue speech bubble with a white outline app icon that you'll find on one of your Home screens, in the app drawer, or by searching.

steps.title: Update your notification settings.
steps.content: Update your notification settings. Since the yellow light indicates an Amazon notification, you can change the settings in the app to change when the light appears. To stop all these notifications, go to Settings > Device Settings > (your Echo Dot) > Communications and tap the toggle off.

steps.title: Wait for an orange light to turn green or purple.
steps.content: Wait for an orange light to turn green or purple. An orange light indicates that your Dot is trying to connect to a Wi-Fi network, so wait for it to connect (indicated by a green light) or fail to connect (indicated by a purple light). [7] X Research source

steps.title: Manually reconnect to Wi-Fi (if your light is purple).
steps.content: Manually reconnect to Wi-Fi (if your light is purple). Open the Alexa app on your phone and connect to your Wi-Fi network again (re-enter the password). [8] X Research source If reconnecting does not work, you may need to check your router to make sure it's on and working. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Unmute your Alexa (if the light is red).
steps.content: Unmute your Alexa (if the light is red). If the light is glowing red, mute is enabled and your Echo will not respond to "Alexa." Press the microphone button again to turn off mute. [10] X Research source
